title: Trump withdraws from UNESCO again as White House slams 'woke' program
shortDescription: One of the United Nations' UNESCO program missions is the World Heritage program, which protects historic and cultural sites.

title: Top Trump officials' stock sales clustered before tariff news
shortDescription: Stock sales by top officials clustered before Trump's major tariff announcements, according to a USA TODAY analysis of transaction forms.

title: Judges block Trump policies through new routes. Here's how
shortDescription: Trump celebrated when the Supreme Court limited nationwide blocks on his policies, but judges are finding other ways to hinder his priorities.

title: Putin stalls. Trump shifts. Ukraine targets Moscow. Latest on the war.
shortDescription: Russian President Vladimir Putin is stalling over a ceasefire. Meanwhile, Trump has changed his mind about sending weapons to Ukraine.

title: Trump 'serious' about Washington Commanders threat, White House says
shortDescription: President Trump isn't kidding around with his new threat to the NFL's Washington Commanders, the White House says.

title: MLK files released. Why is King’s family unhappy with Trump’s move?
shortDescription: The National Archives released over 240,000 pages of records in accordance with an executive order from January.

title: Hunter: Ambien affected Biden’s debate
shortDescription: Hunter Biden told YouTube personality Andrew Callaghan that former President Joe Biden took Ambien before his poor debate with Donald Trump.

title: Can Trump deport visa holders over speech? Federal judge to soon decide
shortDescription: U.S. District Judge William Young, who previously blocked the administration's termination of NIH grants, presided over the two-week nonjury trial.

title: 'Flood' of ICE agents coming to Democrat-run cities, White House warns
shortDescription: Migrant-rights groups worry that harsher enforcement will lead to more civil rights violations and prompt community pushback.

title: Trump's quest for Republican majority runs through Texas
shortDescription: At Trump's urging, Texas Gov. Greg Abbott has requested lawmakers potentially redraw the state's electoral map. Opponents warn it could backfire.

title: Hunter Biden says Joe Biden was taking Ambien before disastrous debate
shortDescription: Hunter Biden said his dad's use of Ambien contributed to Joe Biden's poor debate performance against Donald Trump in the 2024 presidential campaign.

title: Trump shares fake-AI video of Obama being arrested to Truth Social
shortDescription: President Donald Trump posted an AI-created fake video of former President Barack Obama being arrested in the Oval Office, wearing an orange jumpsuit.

title: Judge who faced Republican impeachment calls to handle DOJ Epstein ask
shortDescription: A judge who faced Republican impeachment calls has been assigned to handle the Trump DOJ's request to release testimony tied to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Harvard, Trump administration face off in court over canceled funding
shortDescription: Harvard University urged a federal judge on Monday to order President Donald Trump's administration to restore about $2.5 billion in funding.

title: Judge reverses Trump cut to attorneys for mentally ill detainees
shortDescription: A U.S. district court judge reversed Trump administration cut to an attorney program aimed at helping detainees ruled mentally incompetent.

title: False TikTok rumor claims Trump has four days to live: What to know
shortDescription: Multiple videos on TikTok claim Trump only has 4 days left to live, but it isn't true. His recent health update revealed 'benign and common' condition

title: Gov. DeSantis calls on Trump admin to release Epstein files

title: Can Trump calm MAGA's fury by releasing more Epstein records?

title: Japan PM Ishiba vows to stay on after bruising election defeat

title: Trump pledged to save Afghans. But UAE had already sent some back.
shortDescription: Days before President Donald Trump said he would help Afghan evacuees who fled their country, the UAE had already begun returning them to Afghanistan.
